My sound is working for but according to lspci ...  Multimedia audio controller: nVidia Corporation: Unknown device  ... what does this mean exactly then ?
do you have an nforce mobo?
if you have an nforce mobo with integrated sound, it may not recognize everything about your sound chipset - it tends to respond to two different driver sets
one of them is the nforce chipset drivers - the other, if its the right chipset, are the Realtek ALC850 drivers
why are there two chipsets ? why does nvidia use Realtek drivers ? why don't they just build drivers for their own chipset ?
its only one chipset, but it responds to both drivers - nvidia doesn't use realtek drivers, realtek uses nvidia drivers, its actually a realtek chip
hmmm ... well if the same chipset responds to both drivers - why don't they show up on lspci ? ... which drivers does lspci check for ?
lspci doesnt check for drivers. it checks for devices that have a driver that has correctly identified them
... and the realtek/nvidia drivers don't correctly identify their chipset ?
you dont have either installed, i dont think
so then it's working off a legacy example ?
